author: jordanmmck
content: this has probably been addressed, but is there any reason why ethereum doesn't support self-executing contracts?

author: jordanmmck
content: ie. execute some function at block X, as long as contract has enough eth to pas for gas of course

author: ajsutton
content: How do you decide what gas price to offer? There's a huge potential for DOS vectors there as well, or even just the burden of long ago forgotten contracts that continue firing off transactions that no one actually cares about. Paying gas provides some protection against this but it's quite expensive just to track whether a tx should be fired for all the contracts in the world state and gas is only paid when they actually trigger.

author: jordanmmck
content: good points. definitely don't want contracts spamming network, even if they have the ETH to pay for it. and yeah, i guess it becomes much more complex for EVM. it would have to keep a huge list of all contracts with automatic execution
